data.title: interaction between pile and soil
data.text:
saeed Saeedd

thanks.but,i think that

if i intoroduce a new element between soil and pile, they will act as frictionless bodies, and no interface would be defined among pile and soil,

or you say that i must tie this new element to soil and pile?Â

Â

--- On Fri, 3/12/10, ziyad algaboby <***@yahoo.com> wrote:

From: ziyad algaboby <***@yahoo.com>

Subject: Re: [Abaqus] interaction between pile and soil

To: ***@yahoogroups.com

Date: Friday, March 12, 2010, 11:33 AM

Â

the best way to model the interaction between pile and soil is to model a thin elements between pile and soil with thickness of .2d (d is diameter of pile). this shaft element could have the same properties of soil. This way was used by Reul, 2000 as he described below:

"For the modelling of the contact zone between soil and

raft, and between soil and the large-diameter bored piles,

thin solid continuum elements have been applied instead of

special interface elements. The contact between structure

and soil was described as perfectly rough. This means that

no relative motion takes place between the nodes of the

finite elements that represent the structure and those of the

finite elements that represent the uppermost layer of soil.

The material behaviour in the contact area was simulated by

the material behaviour of the soil."

Hope this help

Ziyad

____________ _________ _________ __

From: saeed <s.salehimalek@ yahoo.com>

To: ***@yahoogroups. com

Sent: Wed, February 24, 2010 11:21:11 AM

i want to model a piled raft foundation.how must i model interaction between soil and pile?
